author: Zeta Ret, Ivo Yankulovski
nohierarchy: All ProtoSS functionality, instance is generated immediately

public_methods.super: args*: function_arguments|Array, cargs*: Array|Boolean, name: String; return Object
public_methods.superize: args*: function_arguments|Array, map: Object, setname: Boolean, setown: Boolean, defname: Boolean; return Object
public_methods.setSuper: superfn*: Function, fn: Function, name: String; return Function
public_methods.setSubclass: fn*: Function, superfn: Function, name: String; return Function
public_methods.callSuper: name*: String, args: Array, cname: String; return Object
public_methods.callSuper2: name*: String, args: Array, cname: String; return Object
public_methods.callSuperX: name*: String, args: Array, cname: String, thiscls: Function; return Object
public_methods.getNextSuper: name*: String, cname: String; return Function
public_methods.getNextSuperX: name*: String, cname: String, thiscls: Function; return Function
public_methods.callProto: proto*: Function, name*: String, args: Array; return Object
public_methods.callProto2: proto*: Object, name*: String, args: Array; return Object
public_methods.callProtoX: proto*: Object, name*: String, args: Array; return Object
public_methods.superList: list*: Array, fn: Function, name: String, defname: Boolean; return Function
public_methods.superList2: list*: Array, fn: Function, name: String, defname: Boolean; return Function
public_methods.getSupers: fn: Function, name: String; return Array
public_methods.getSupers2: fn: Function, name: String; return Array
public_methods.getReversedSupers: fn: Function, name: String; return Array
public_methods.hasSuper: sfn*: Function, fn: Function, name: String; return Boolean
public_methods.is: sfn*: Function, fn: Function, name: String; return Boolean
public_methods.abstract: name: String, amap: Object, defname: Boolean; return Function
public_methods.implement: superfn*: Function, fn: Function, name: String; return Function
public_methods.interface: name: String, imap: Object, defname: Boolean; return Function
public_methods.statis: args*: function_arguments|Array, statis: Function, _super: Object, setname: Boolean, setown: Boolean, defname: Boolean; return Object
public_methods.namespace: ns*: String, cls*: Function, pack: Object; return Object
public_methods.usens: ns*: String, pack: Object; return Object
public_methods.internal: cls*: Function, pack: Object; return Object
public_methods.package: name*: String, scope: Object; return Object

rndstr.l: generates random string with length of characters

super.args: function arguments object if supported, or manually created Array [] with assigned 'callee' reference to the function class object
super.cargs: Array used to call 'apply' of the super constructor function, Boolean true will use arguments as call arguments (cargs=args)
super.name: String used to define the name of the constructor in the prototype, default __constructor

superize.args: function arguments object if supported, or manually created Array [] with assigned 'callee' reference to the function class object
superize.map: if null will use 'this' object to enumerate all assigned functions, used for member methods, functions in map will be assigned to 'this'
superize.setname: changes name of iterated function according to key, function.aname
superize.setown: adds constructor name to function name, requires setname, i.e. 'myfunction#myclass', function.oname
superize.defname: adds setname and setown to function.name property
superize.return: with all functions assigned to this function class in particular

setSuper.superfn: the super function of fn or this
setSuper.fn: if null will use this function, fn extends superfn in effect, fn is subclass of superfn
setSuper.name: if null will use default __constructor
setSuper.return: superfn will be returned for chain calls

setSubclass.fn: fn extends superfn in effect, fn is subclass of superfn
setSubclass.superfn: if null will use this function, the super function of fn
setSubclass.name: if null will use default __constructor
setSubclass.return: superfn will be returned for chain calls

callSuper.name: name of super function
callSuper.cname: constructor name, if null will use __constructor
callSuper.return: result of next super function different than this[name] function

callSuper2.name: name of super function
callSuper2.cname: constructor name, if null will use __constructor
callSuper2.return: result of super function, may call the same function object as this[name] function

callSuperX.name: name of super function
callSuperX.cname: constructor name, if null will use __constructor
callSuperX.thiscls: accepts current constructor class scope for continues upwards super calls, uses getNextSuperX, works with super constructor lists, compatible with XeltoSS (ProtoSS JS Class)
callSuperX.return: result of next super function different than thiscls.prototype.map[name] function or this.map[name] function

getNextSuper.name: search super function by name in super map created by superize
getNextSuper.cname: constructor name, if null will use __constructor
getNextSuper.return: next function in super maps after calling getSupers()

getNextSuperX.name: search super function by name in super map created by superize
getNextSuperX.cname: constructor name, if null will use __constructor
getNextSuperX.thiscls: accepts current constructor class scope for interpolating next super properly, detects prototype method maps, compatible with XeltoSS (ProtoSS JS Class)
getNextSuperX.return: next function in super maps after calling getSupers() on thiscls or this

getSuper.return: super object map of next super class as it was created by superize

getThis.return: super object map of this object as it was created by superize

callProto.proto: prototype constructor function of any of the supers, it will use super object map by proto.name
callProto.name: name of the function to call on the super object map
callProto.return: result of the super prototype function as it is defined in its function scope

callProto2.proto: super object map obtained from the same object, may simulate by using an Object with assigned 'constructor' from the supers
callProto2.name: name of the function to call on the super object map
callProto2.return: result of the super prototype function as it is defined in its function scope

callProtoX.proto: prototype constructor function of any of the supers, it will use super object map by proto.name or prototype of the function
callProtoX.name: name of the function to call on the super object map or prototype of the function
callProtoX.return: result of the super prototype function as it is defined in its function scope, support of XeltoSS (ProtoSS JS Class) prototype chain

superList.list: list of constructor functions used as supers
superList.fn: if null will use this, fn extends aggregate function which calls the list with constructors, the aggregate function uses __constructor_list instead of __constructor
superList.name: name of constructor, if null will use __constructor
superList.defname: adds function.name property, aname is always added now

superList2.list: list of constructor functions used as supers
superList2.fn: if null will use this, fn extends aggregate function which calls the list with constructors (uses same arguments for all supers, superList requires an array of arguments, each index exactly matching the super index), the aggregate function uses __constructor_list instead of __constructor
superList2.name: name of constructor, if null will use __constructor
superList2.defname: adds function.name property, aname is always added now

getSupers.name: if null will use __constructor
getSupers.return: all super constructor functions, allows caching inside function object

getSupers2.name: if null will use __constructor
getSupers2.return: super constructor function or functions (if super is aggregate will use __constructor_list

getReversedSupers.name: if null will use __constructor
getReversedSupers.return: all super constructor functions, reversed order

hasSuper.fn: if null will use this, to obtain all supers
hasSuper.name: if null will use __constructor
hasSuper.return: true - if it exists in the inheritance tree, otherwise false

is.fn: if null will use this, to obtain all supers
is.name: if null will use __constructor
is.return: true - if it exists in the inheritance tree or equals this constructor, otherwise false

abstract.name: if null will use ZetaRet_Abstract_XXX13XXX
abstract.amap: if null will use this, i.e. {term:0,date:0,record:3}.abstract()
abstract.defname: adds function.name property, aname is always added now
abstract.return: afn is aggregate function which generates methods according to map (uses statis), if key-value pair is [0,false,null,undefined,''] will throw abstract error, otherwise will return the value from the object map (i.e. .record() returns 3), abstract class throws error on instance, must be subclassed

implement.superfn: the super function of fn or this
implement.fn: if null will use this function, fn extends superfn in effect, fn is subclass of superfn
implement.name: if null will use default __constructor
implement.return: superfn will be returned for chain calls, [implement calls setSuper]

interface.name: if null will use ZetaRet_Interface_XXX13XXX
interface.imap: if null will use this, i.e. {term:[String, Number],date:[Date],record:[CustomRecordClass, IRecordData]}.interface()
interface.defname: adds function.name property, aname is always added now
interface.return: ifn is aggregate function which generates methods according to map (uses statis), methods will test arguments against map value input types, each method returns true or false, depending on matched types

final.args: compares this.constructor and args.callee, will throw error if not equal, a class with final call must not be a super

statis.args: function arguments object if supported, or manually created Array [] with assigned 'callee' reference to the function class object
statis.statis: static function assign to object, these functions act like prototype functions and as such are not generated per new instance (superize), statis(Object s, Function constructor){s.myf=function(){};}
statis._super: if null will use callee[prfx+callee.name+sffx] object to enumerate all assigned functions, used for member methods, functions in map will be assigned to 'this'
statis.setname: changes name of iterated function according to key, function.aname
statis.setown: adds constructor name to function name, requires setname, i.e. 'myfunction#myclass', function.oname
statis.defname: adds setname and setown to function.name property
statis.return: all functions assigned to this function class

getSuperName.return: package+::+name, works only on instances using constructor static properties

getSuperName2.return: package+::+name, works on instances and classes using constructor static properties

namespace.ns: id of namespace, will create new package in effect with prefix
namespace.cls: function to import into package, uses internal call

usens.return: resolved package object using namespace prefix

package.name: name of package, use .(dot) for delimiter
package.scope: if null uses this, scope for attaching/reading package, use window in most of the time or globally accessible object
